definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
pure and innocent like the heart of a newborn/sincere

sentences.english: This kind of person has a pure heart, so we can communicate with each other by heart.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的朋友有一顆赤子之心，我們能用心來彼此交流。

sentences.english: What is innocence and why should it be cherished?
sentences.chinese: 天真無邪又是什麼，爲什麼應該要珍惜赤子之心？

sentences.english: To sacrifice life and devote our loyal for your dignity.
sentences.chinese: 我們隨時準備犧牲生命，奉獻一顆顆赤子之心。

sentences.english: I love winter, like the pure love of the mother in general.
sentences.chinese: 我愛冬天，像赤子眷戀母親一般。

sentences.english: The public finances are set to go into deficit this year.
sentences.chinese: 本年度公共財政講出現赤子。

sentences.english: His enchantment comes from his childlike pureness and sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 其魅力緣於他的赤子般“純念”和孺子般“真誠”。

sentences.english: This childlike quality may account for why I miss the past so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 赤子的個性也許可以解釋爲何我是如此的懷念過去。

sentences.english: The results indicated:(1) Eisenia foetida is suitable for dealing with pig and chicken manure .
sentences.chinese: 赤子愛勝蚓適宜於處理豬糞和雞糞。

definition: pure and innocent like the heart of a newborn/sincere
Buddha-like heart (full of compassion)/spirit of Buddha (awakened to reality and no longer clinging to appearances)
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
